title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: Harry Potter, a young wizard, discovers his magical heritage on his 11th birthday when he receives a letter to Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A gripping tale of racial injustice and childhood innocence in the American South during the 1930s.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
description: In a seemingly perfect community without war, pain, suffering, differences or choice, a young boy is chosen to learn from an elderly man about the true pain and pleasure of the real world.

title: Wonder
author: R.J. Palacio
description: August Pullman was born with a facial difference that prevented him from going to a mainstream schoolâ€”until now. He's about to start 5th grade at Beecher Prep.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a post-apocalyptic world, Katniss Everdeen volunteers for the Hunger Games to save her sister, entering a televised fight to the death.

title: Percy Jackson & The Lightning Thief
author: Rick Riordan
description: Percy Jackson discovers he's a demigod, the son of Poseidon, and must prevent a war between the gods by finding Zeus's missing lightning bolt.

title: Holes
author: Louis Sachar
description: Stanley Yelnats is sent to a detention center where the boys dig holes every day as punishment, but there's more to the digging than meets the eye.

title: The Outsiders
author: S.E. Hinton
description: The story of Ponyboy Curtis and his struggles with right and wrong in a society in which he believes that he is an outsider.

title: Matilda
author: Roald Dahl
description: Matilda is a brilliant child with a vivid imagination, but her parents think she's just a nuisance. When she starts school, she meets the kind Miss Honey.

title: Bridge to Terabithia
author: Katherine Paterson
description: Jesse and Leslie create an imaginary kingdom in the woods called Terabithia, but their friendship faces an unexpected tragedy.

title: Hatchet
author: Gary Paulsen
description: After a plane crash, 13-year-old Brian must survive alone in the Canadian wilderness with only a hatchet as his tool.

title: The Maze Runner
author: James Dashner
description: Thomas wakes up in a mysterious place called the Glade, surrounded by a massive maze, with no memory of his past.

title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid
author: Jeff Kinney
description: The humorous journal of Greg Heffley as he navigates the challenges of middle school.

title: Where the Red Fern Grows
author: Wilson Rawls
description: Billy works hard to save money for two hunting dogs, and together they become the best hunting team in the Ozark Mountains.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Set in Nazi Germany, this is the story of Liesel, a young girl who steals books and shares them with others during the horrors of World War II.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins, a comfortable hobbit, is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug.
